abstract.text: 3 4 Supplementary Figure 1. Electron density for the FAN1-DNA complexes. (a) The 5 substrate scanning form ( P FAN1 shown as orange coils and A FAN1 as grey coils). 6 Example experimental electron density (blue meshes, 2.8 Å resolution, contoured at 1.5 7 σ) is shown in the left panels. Right panel: Example electron density (blue meshes, 2.2 Å 8 resolution, contoured at 1.5σ) of DNA (yellow sticks) in the unbiased 2Fo-Fc simulated-9 annealing composite-omit map (torsion angle dynamics at 1000K using CNS 1 ). (b) The 10 substrate-unwinding form ( P FAN1 shown as orange coils and A FAN1 shown as cyan 11 coils). Top panel: Example electron density (blue meshes, contoured at 1σ) of DNA 12 (green coils) in the unbiased 2Fo-Fc simulated-annealing composite-omit map (torsion 13 angle dynamics at 1000K using CNS). Bottom panel: Simulated annealing (torsion angle 14 dynamics at 3000K using Phenix) 2mFo-DFc map is contoured at 1.0σ as blue meshes 15 around 4Å radius of the complex. (c) The substrate-latching form. Top panel: Example 16 electron density (blue meshes, contoured at 1.7 σ) of DNA (green coils) in the unbiased 17 mFo-DFc simulated-annealing composite-omit map (torsion angle dynamics at 1000K 18 using Phenix). Bottom panel: Simulated annealing (torsion angle dynamics at 2500K 19 using Phenix) 2mFo-DFc map is contoured at 1.0σ as grey meshes around 4Å radius of 20 the complex. (d) The stereo view of the experimental electron density map of the 21 105 106 107 108 109 110 111 112 Supplementary Figure 8. Twinning analysis of the substrate-unwinding form (a) 113 and the substrate-latching form (b) data. The left plots are the L tests 5 and right plots 114 are the maximum likelihood estimation of the twinning fractions 6 for the twinning 115 operator (h, -k-h, -l).

body_text.text: substrate scanning form complex in the entire asymmetric unit of the crystal. Table 1 , 2) were resolved in a 18% polyacrylamide denaturing gel 36 running for 3 hours. (c) 0.5, 2, 5 nM of FAN1 373-1017 wild type or 5 nM of D960A mutant 37 was incubated with 5' 32 P-radiolabeled 5' flap (10-1-10) substrate (5 nM) at 37 °C for 5 38 minutes, and the reaction mixtures were resolved in a 18% polyacrylamide denaturing 39 gel. dT 5 and dT 10 were loaded as size markers. FIGREF0.text: Summary of FAN1 nuclease activity and design of 26 mutants. (a) Left four panels: 2, 5, 20 nM of FAN1 373-1017 wild type or 20 nM of D960A 27 mutant was incubated with 5' 32 P-radiolabeled 5'-flap or 3'-flap substrate (5 nM each) at 28 37 °C for 5 minutes, and the reaction mixtures were resolved in a 9% polyacrylamide 29 denaturing gel. The schematics of the substrates are shown on the bottom and * 30 represents the radiolabel. Right two panels: 16, 32, 64 nM of FAN1 373-1017 wild type or 64 31 nM of D960A mutant was incubated with 5' 32 P-radiolabeled dsDNA or dT80 ssDNA 32 substrate (5 nM each) at 37 °C for 5 minutes, and the reaction mixtures were resolved in a 33 9% polyacrylamide denaturing gel. (b) Determination of the size of the endonuclease 34 products by FAN1 373-1017 on 5' flap DNA. The reaction mixtures and the markers 35 (Supplementary

Clusters of the mutations used in this work are labelled and highlighted using colored ovalsQuantification of the DNA-binding and nuclease activities of FAN1 and its dimerization mutants. The error bars represent standard deviation 48 from three independent experiments. (a)-(b) Quantification of the endo-(a) and 49 exonuclease (b) activities of FAN1 373-1017 and its dimerization mutants on 5' flap DNA 50 substrate, related to Fig. 2h. (c) Quantification of the 5' flap DNA-binding activity of 51 FAN1 373-1017 and its dimerization mutants, related to Fig. 2g. 10/300 column (GE Healthcare) in buffer containing 20 54 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 80 mM NaCl, and 0.1 mM TCEP. The D960A mutant is used to 55 prevent the hydrolysis of DNA. The molecular weights are calculated based on elution 56 volumes and the calibration curve performed under identical experimental conditions 57 (upper panel). The UV absorbance ratio OD 260nm/280nm for the elusion peaks are: Exonuclease activity of FAN1 and its mutants on dsDNA. 66 (a) 16, 32, 64 nM of FAN1 373-1017 and its mutants were incubated with 5' 32 P-labelled 67 blunt-end dsDNA at 37 °C for 5 minutes, and the reaction mixtures were resolved in a 9% polyacrylamide denaturing gel. (b) Quantification of the exonuclease activity. Quantification of the DNA-binding and nuclease activities 72 of FAN1 and its DNA binding mutants on 5' flap DNA substrate. The error bars 73 represent standard deviation from three independent experiments. (a)-(b) Quantification of the endo-(a) and exonuclease (b) activities of FAN1 373-1017 and its DNAComparison of FAN1 homologs from different species. (a) 79 Surface conservation of FAN1 homologs. Homology-modelled structures of FAN1 80 homologs (sequences from Uniprot 2 entries) from Vertebrates (Pan troglodytes(K6ZTI7) 81 or chimpanzee, Mus musculus (Q69ZT1) or mice, Plant (Oryza sativa (Q5SNL7) or rice), 82 Nematode (Caenorhabditis elegans (P90740)), Fungi (Aspergillus clavatus (A1CDL2)), 83 and Bacteria (Pseudomonas sp. CF149 (S6HZB4), Photobacterium sp. SKA34 84 (Q2BYW8) and Pseudomonas aeruginosa (strain PA7) (A6V6U9)) are generated by 85 Phyre2 3 using one-to-one threading based on our FAN1 structure (substrate-scanning 86 form). Conservation is calculated based on the percentage of identical residues among 87 multiple sequences at a specific position. The colour scheme in Chimera 4 is used: red, 88 most conserved (identical fraction: 9/9); blue, least conserved (as the vertebrate FAN1 89 molecules are very similar, the least conserved faction is 3/9). The corresponding human 90 FAN1 residues are labelled. Two views were chosen to highlight the functional regions 91 bordered in yellow and marked in FAN1-DNA complex schematic (middle inset). The 92 corresponding sequence alignment is shown in Supplementary Figure 7. (b)-(c) Helix α9 93 structural models from the above FAN1 homologs are clustered into a short-helix group 94 in prokaryotes (b) and a long-helix group in eukaryotes (c). Main-chains are shown as 95 ribbons and side-chains of residues aligned to K525/R526/K528 of human FAN1 are 96 shown as sticks. Sequence alignment of regions of FAN1. (a) Human FAN1 99 dimerization core helix α 9 . (b) Active site. (c) A-Duplex and Flap interface. (d) P-Duplex 100 interface. Residues are colored in the ClustalX color scheme, and the predicted secondary 101 structures are shaded as following: loops, no shade; helices, yellow shade; strands, green 102 shade.
